grading.policies: This grading scheme is subject to change based on student outcomes. It may be curved more leniently.

assignments.description: 4 homework assignments and one large (individual) project during the semester.
Additional small assignments and quizzes will accompany certain lectures.

policies.attendance: Attendance is required; no late assignments will be accepted without prior approval.
policies.late_work: No late assignments, without prior approval, will be accepted.
policies.academic_integrity: Copying solutions from other students or sources is strictly forbidden and will be dealt with according to the Stevens honor board policy.
policies.accommodations: Virtual office hours via Zoom can be arranged if requested.

additional_info.course_format: The lectures will combine lectures, guest presentations, class presentations, and discussions.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Students will be expected to install and have Python running on their computers.
additional_info.support_resources: Questions about course material can be asked by email or in the Discussion Section of Canvas.

course_info.title: Natural Language Processing for Financial Applications

_metadata.course_description: This course focuses on natural language processing (NLP) models and their applications to finance.
learning_outcomes: Be able to apply NLP to financial problems
Be able to evaluate the performance of different methods to determine the best method/hyperparameters
Learn how to interpret results of NLP in a financial context
Create and apply NLP models for analyzing financial reports and news
Evaluate performance of trained NLP models for sentiment analysis
Understand applicability of diverse NLP techniques
